item.title: 中印关系紧张，比亚迪在印度遥控运营
item.description: 中国比亚迪股份有限公司（BYD Co., Ltd.）正努力拓展印度市场，尽管政府设置的障碍阻碍了这家电动汽车制造商在印度开展重要业务。【原文：China’s BYD Co. is forging ahead with its attempts to expand in India despite roadblocks from the government that are preventing the electric vehicle maker from conducting key business dealings there.】

item.title: 中国政府瞄准产能过剩，中国钢铁业利润回升
item.description: 上个月，中国钢厂的盈利能力开始恢复，如果政府兑现解决产能过剩的承诺，下半年的改善速度可能会加快。【原文：The profitability of Chinese steel mills began to recover last month, with the improvement likely to accelerate in the second half of the year if the government delivers on its pledges to tackle overcapacity.】

item.title: 三星获得 165 亿美元交易，芯片制造部门大获全胜
item.description: 三星电子公司达成了一项 22.8 万亿韩元（约合 165 亿美元）的协议，为一家身份不明的客户生产芯片，这可能是其合同半导体制造业务的一次重大胜利。【原文：Samsung Electronics Co. struck a 22.8 trillion won ($16.5 billion) agreement to produce chips for an unidentified client, a potentially big win for its contract semiconductor manufacturing business.】

item.title: 美欧贸易协议缓解部分避险需求，黄金维持跌势
item.description: 在美国和欧盟宣布达成关税协议后，黄金走势趋于稳定，避免了一些人对两个经济体之间可能爆发令人痛苦的贸易战的担忧。【原文：Gold steadied after the US and European Union announced they had reached a tariff agreement, staving off some concerns about a potentially painful trade war between the economies.】

item.title: 欧盟在最后期限前就美国贸易协议达成一致，石油价格保持稳定
item.description: 美国和欧盟在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）规定的 8 月 1 日关税截止日期前达成贸易协议后，石油市场趋于稳定。【原文：Oil steadied after the US and European Union agreed on a trade deal ahead of President Donald Trump’s tariff deadline of Aug. 1.】

item.title: 随着收入增长，澳门赌场牛市有望延续
item.description: 卖方分析师表示，随着特别活动和豪华酒店产品有助于推动博彩总收入复苏，澳门赌场股有望继续保持近期的优异表现。【原文：Macau casino stocks are poised to continue their recent outperformance as special events and luxury hotel offerings help drive a recovery in gross gaming revenue, sell-side analysts say.】

item.title: 阿里巴巴云远见卓识者期待 OpenAI 炒作后的大变革
item.description: OpenAI 的 ChatGPT 引发了一场人工智能开发和投资的革命。然而，阿里巴巴集团控股有限公司（Alibaba Group Holding Ltd.）云计算和人工智能部门的创始人表示，此后兴起的技术和服务的十分之九可能会在十年内消失。【原文：OpenAI’s ChatGPT started a revolution in artificial intelligence development and investment. Yet nine-tenths of the technology and services that’ve sprung up since could be gone in under a decade, according to the founder of Alibaba Group Holding Ltd.’s cloud and AI unit.】

item.title: 中美谈判代表在斯德哥尔摩会晤，以延长贸易停战期
item.description: 美国和中国官员将于周一举行会议，将关税缓和关系延长至 8 月中旬的最后期限之后，并就进一步化解贸易紧张局势的其他方法进行讨价还价。【原文：US and Chinese officials are meeting Monday to extend their tariff detente beyond a mid-August deadline, and haggle over other ways to further defuse trade tensions.】

item.title: 特朗普同意欧盟关税协议后美国期货攀升：市场综述
item.description: 美国和欧盟达成协议，将对欧盟大多数出口商品征收 15%的关税，从而避免了一场可能造成破坏的贸易战，此后美国股市期货攀升。【原文：US equity futures climbed after the US and European Union struck a deal that will see the bloc face 15% tariffs on most exports, averting a potentially damaging trade war.】

item.title: 澳大利亚养老基金的套期保值活动将推高当地货币汇率
item.description: 澳元将进一步走高，因为该国最大的养老基金有理由加强对其美国资产的对冲，使其免受政策不确定性的影响。【原文：The Australian dollar is set for further gains as the nation’s biggest pension funds have reason to boost hedging of their US assets to shield them from policy uncertainties.】

item.title: 特朗普关税已阻碍世界经济增长，市场却耸耸肩
item.description:
随着总统新贸易协议的出台，美国的保护主义正在放慢投资速度，并以牺牲全球经济为代价重新构建供应链

。【原文：

With the president’s new trade deals, US protectionism is slowing investment and rewiring supply chains at the expense of the global economy

】

item.title: 尽管交易推迟，投资者仍重燃对长江和记的兴趣
item.description: 尽管长江和记实业有限公司出售 43 个港口的计划被推迟，但投资者对该公司的投资热情仍在恢复，而一家中国航运巨头正在参与这项全球交易的消息也助长了投资者的乐观情绪。【原文：Investors are regaining enthusiasm for CK Hutchison Holdings Ltd. despite a delay in the company’s plan to sell 43 ports, with optimism fueled by news that a Chinese shipping behemoth is finding its way into the global deal.】

item.title: 欧洲与美国达成贸易协议，股票投资者期待反弹
item.description: 在美国和欧盟达成贸易协议后，投资者预计汽车制造商和奢侈品制造商将在周一重新开市时引领欧洲股市出现缓解性反弹。【原文：Investors expect automakers and luxury goods makers to lead a relief rally in European stocks when the market reopens on Monday, after the US and European Union agreed to a trade deal.】

item.title: 在贸易动荡中达成 350 亿美元科技交易
item.description:
Synopsys首席财务官谢拉格-格拉瑟（Shelagh Glaser）讲述了围绕安世公司交易的最后一刻发生的一些戏剧性事件。【原文：

Synopsys CFO Shelagh Glaser recounts some last-minute drama around the deal for Ansys. Plus, a one-on-one with the finance chief of Colombia’s biggest lender.

】

item.title: 油价徘徊在 70 美元夏季和日益增长的过剩担忧之间
item.description: 石油交易商们正在努力应对紧张局势；越来越多的人警告说，今年晚些时候到 2026 年市场将走弱，但目前价格仍坚挺在每桶 70 美元附近。【原文：Oil traders are grappling with a tension — there’s a growing chorus of warnings about the market weakening later this year and into 2026, but for now prices are holding strong near $70 a barrel.】

item.title: 数据洪流为本周市场带来 "关键时刻
item.description: 华尔街专业人士正面临关键的一周，这一周很可能会为今年下半年的市场和经济定下基调。【原文：Wall Street pros are staring down a pivotal week that will likely set the tone for the rest of the year in markets and the economy.】

item.title: 债券交易员等待美联储会议、再融资和七月就业报告
item.description: 债券投资者将进入紧张的一周，包括财政部对季度债务销售的最新看法、美联储会议以及以 7 月份就业报告为首的大量数据。【原文：Bond investors enter a frenetic week comprising the latest Treasury view on quarterly debt sales, a Federal Reserve meeting, and plenty of data crowned by the July jobs report.】

item.title: 俄罗斯首次开通莫斯科至平壤直飞航班
item.description: 俄罗斯首架从莫斯科直飞朝鲜平壤的航班于周日晚间起飞，这标志着俄罗斯与这个孤立的共产主义国家的关系不断加深。【原文：Russia’s first direct flight from Moscow to Pyongyang, North Korea, took off Sunday evening, in a sign of deepening ties with the isolated Communist state.】

item.title: 哈佛讽刺、旋律优美的数学家汤姆-莱勒逝世，享年 97 岁
item.description: 据《纽约时报》报道，汤姆-莱勒（Tom Lehrer）去世了，这位哈佛大学毕业的数学家曾作为美国最受欢迎的讽刺作曲家之一短暂演出，用曲调捕捉了二十世纪五六十年代的一些焦虑和荒谬。享年 97 岁。【原文：Tom Lehrer, the Harvard-educated mathematician whose brief side gig as one of America’s favorite satirical composers captured in tune some of the anxieties and absurdities of the 1950s and 1960s, has died, according to the New York Times. He was 97.】

item.title: 波音国防工人拒绝接受合同，这是劳工动荡的标志
item.description: 波音公司的圣路易斯防务中心面临着罢工的风险，因为工会工人拒绝了在四年内将工资提高20%的合同提议。【原文：Boeing Co. faces a risk of a strike in its St. Louis defense hub after union workers rejected a contract offer that would boost their wages by 20% over four years.】

item.title: 投资者关注秋季降息，美联储将展开激烈辩论
item.description: 尽管在本周的政策会议上争论日益激烈，但美联储官员决心再维持一段时间的利率稳定，这可能会增强秋季降息的预期。【原文：Federal Reserve officials are determined to hold interest rates steady a little while longer, though an increasingly contentious debate at this week’s policy meeting may bolster expectations for rate cuts in the fall.】

item.title: 南华早报》称中美有望将贸易休战延长90天
item.description: 据《南华早报》援引未具名消息人士的话报道，中美有望将关税休战再延长三个月。【原文：US and China are expected to extend their tariff truce by another three months, the South China Morning Post reported, citing unnamed sources.】

item.title: 交易员为创历史新高的股票套期保值涉足异类期权
item.description: 投资者希望在股价处于高位时防止回调，因此他们的投资方式已经超出了普通期权的范畴。【原文：Investors looking to protect against a pullback with stocks at peaks are venturing beyond plain-vanilla options.】

item.title: Meme 股票狂热回归让交易员警惕市场泡沫
item.description: 上周，meme 股票狂热再次出现，这让专业投资者面临两难境地：是抓住散户交易者的兴奋点，还是将其视为最新的警示信号，即浮躁的市场将出现回调。【原文：The reemergence of meme stock mania last week has professional investors facing a quandary: ride the excitement of retail traders or take it as the latest warning sign that the frothy markets are due for a pullback.】

item.title: 新兴市场债务对冲基金关注保障措施，全球反弹势头蓬勃发展
item.description: 随着发展中国家资产广泛反弹的深化，专门投资新兴市场债务的对冲基金正越来越多地转向风险缓解策略，以确保锁定两位数的收益。【原文：Hedge funds dedicated to emerging-market debt are increasingly turning to risk-mitigating strategies to ensure they lock in double digit gains as a broad rally in developing nation assets deepens.】

item.title: 作为特朗普倡议的一部分，阿特金斯-雷利斯公司将申请核许可证
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》报道，加拿大阿特金斯-雷利斯集团（AtkinsRealis Group）计划申请美国核反应堆许可证，以充分利用唐纳德-特朗普总统的原子能倡议。【原文：Canada’s AtkinsRealis Group plans to apply for a US nuclear reactor license in a bid to leverage President Donald Trump’s atomic power initiative, the Financial Times reported.】

item.title: 以色列取消部分加沙援助限制，以化解饥饿呼声
item.description: 上周末，以色列取消了对加沙援助物资发放的限制，以化解国际社会对这块支离破碎的巴勒斯坦飞地饥饿危机日益高涨的强烈抗议。【原文：Israel rolled back curbs on aid distribution to Gaza over the weekend in an effort to defuse a growing international outcry over the hunger crisis convulsing the shattered Palestinian enclave.】

item.title: 香港财务总监预计第二季度零售销售将反弹
item.description: 香港财政司司长陈茂波表示，他预计第二季度私人消费将在连续 12 个多月下降后出现反弹。【原文：Hong Kong Financial Secretary Paul Chan said he expects a bounce-back in second-quarter private consumption, following more than 12 months of decline.】

item.title: 中国工业利润在价格战中连续第二个月下降
item.description: 中国工业收益连续第二个月下降，政府将加大力度抑制过度竞争，因为过度竞争拖累了价格，加剧了美国关税带来的痛苦。【原文：China’s industrial earnings fell for a second straight month, with authorities set to intensify their drive to rein in excessive competition that’s dragging down prices and compounding the pain from US tariffs.】

item.title: 全球资金追逐全球最炙手可热的韩国主要股市
item.description: 韩国股票已经成为今年全球主要市场中表现最好的股票，随着旨在提高估值和赋予小股东权力的大胆监管改革取得成效，韩国股票正成为吸引外国投资者的磁石。【原文：South Korean stocks, already this year’s best performers among the world’s major markets, are becoming a magnet for foreign investors as bold regulatory reforms to lift valuations and empower minority shareholders gain traction.】
